title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: We go down by Broadmeadows^ now held by that Yair " Hoppringle," — who so well governed Scinde, — and into the grounds of Bowhill, and passing Philiphaugh, see where stout David Lesly crossed in the mist at daybreak with his heavy dragoons, many of them old soldiers of Gustavus, and routed the gallant Graeme ; and there is Slainmen^s Lee, where the royalists lie ; and there is Carterhaugh,  the scene of the strange wild story of Tamlane and Lady Janet, when
